newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: TENNIS-RAFTER NOT CONFIDENT ABOUT FRENCH OPEN.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-RAFTER NOT CONFIDENT ABOUT FRENCH OPEN.

text.p: Australian Patrick Rafter expressed little optimism for next week's French Open despite a 6-1 4-6 6-3 semifinal win over Sweden's Magnus Norman at the St. Poelten Grand Prix on Friday.

Rafter, the only remaining seed in St.Poelten, who on Thursday eliminated world number five Thomas Muster, felt he wound not win the Roland Garros title, but was pleased with his performance on the clay court here.
"I played good tennis in the first set. Then Magnus fought back and gave me a hard match. But it was good," said Rafter, one of the few players on the tour to play serve and volley on clay.
On Saturday, Rafter will be seeking to clinch his first tournament on clay when he meets the 73rd ranked Marcelo Filippini of Uruguay.

Filippini had little trouble getting past Slovak Dominik Hrbaty 7-6 6-1 in Friday's first semifinal. Hrbaty had sent second seed and French Open champion Yevgeny Kafelnikov crashing out of the first round on Tuesday in straight sets.
Other seeds to have been eliminated in St.Poelten include Chile's Marcelo Rios and Switzerland's Marc Rosset in the second round, as well as Britain's Tim Henman in round one.
